custom_database

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • custom_database.Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    Database Class reads and writes to data folder using 4 methods. The four methods are as follows.
    • readCards() Receives the theme and passes it to the setImagePath method.
    • setImagePath() Switches the image path based on the user theme selection.
    • writeSave() Writes the high score (lowest time) to a text file.
    • readSave() Reads the high score (lowest time) from a text file.

    Data folder contains:

    • "256x256_retro_game_pngs" (folder) which contains "_nintendo_icons.txt" and 18 images.
    • "256x256_animal_pngs" (folder) which contains "_animal_icons.txt" and 18 images.
    • "high_score.txt"

    NOTE: The data folder *MUST* be moved into the dist folder after a clean and build .jar is created.

      • Database

        public Database()

    • Method Detail

      • readCards

        public void readCards(java.lang.String theme)
        readCards method reads in the theme, calls setImagePath method, and passes the cards array and theme.
        Parameters:
        theme - is the user selected theme of the card images.

      • writeSave

        public void writeSave(int size,
                      int winTime)
        writeSave method writes high scores to "high_score.txt" in the data folder. The high scores are written as 3 comma delimited strings. They are written in the order: easyScore,intmScore,hardScore. example: 8,29,215
        Parameters:
        size - is the size of the game board.
        winTime - is the time elapsed after the user wins the game.

      • readSave

        public java.lang.String[] readSave()
        readSave method reads the high scores from "high_score.txt" in the data folder. Uses a buffered reader to read the three comma delimited strings from the text file into the three elements in the values array.
        Returns:
        values returns the three strings.
